author: greystroke
content:
I think if you talk to stakers,  you'll find a major reason for the low usage of the consolidation queue will be time to develop the tooling for batch consolidations. Lido is in the process of upgrading their smart contracts to start consolidations. I also feel like we should talk to stakers and give more time for them to consolidate before making changes that may penalize smaller solo stakers like a 0x01 withdrawal fee.

All things being equal,  I think any additional dev bandwidth for Glamsterdam on the consensus side should be focused towards higher impact upgrades with strong community buy-in and urgency such as FOCiL.

author: fradamt
content: Why would it penalize smaller solo stakers when they can easily migrate to 0x02? On the dev bandwidth side I agree, except in that it should be focused on the massive feature we have already scheduled

author: fradamt
content: It doesn't really disincentivize consolidation because you still earn rewards while you're in the exit queue, it might take longer to process but it doesn't become costlier. It will of course reduce the effective consolidation throughput as some of it is taken up by exits, but I am not sure if we care about this from the perspective of reducing the validator set size, because at the end of the day an exit does that too (so whichever consolidation throughput we lose to exits shouldn't really hurt us in that sense, except for stake that ends up being re-deposited without even consolidating, which seems probably marginal in practice and also bounded by the deposit cap)
